lead_paragraph: As international powers intensify military and diplomatic activities in Syria, residents in besieged areas have gone without access to food and medicine.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, HWAIDA SAAD and SOMINI SENGUPTA

headline.print_headline: Starving Syrians Go Without Aid as Powers Feud
headline.main: Starving Syrians in Madaya Are Denied Aid Amid Political Jockeying

snippet: As international powers intensify military and diplomatic activities in Syria, residents in besieged areas have gone without access to food and medicine.
abstract: International humanitarian workers report malnutrition has spiked as cause of death in Syrian towns like Madaya, near Lebanese border, where residents are starving due to siege on town by pro-government forces; many residents in town like Madaya, where humanitarian aid cannot reach trapped citizens, have abandoned thoughts of political change in face of hunger, sign of utter failure of international powers to resolve conflict.
